Goblin.Name: Goblin
Goblin.Description: Goblins wield a crude spear and attack from melee range. Individually, they are relatively weak but can pose a threat in large numbers.
Goblin.Flavortext: Aberrations that have manifested from dark mana, summoned by an event known as the Awakening. These orc-like creatures have constructed rudimentary tools, clothing, and a tribal system. These particular ones seem to fulfill the role of soldiers in their tribes.

BowGoblin.Name: Goblin Bowyer
BowGoblin.Description: Goblins with a bow and arrow to shoot enemies from afar. They are effective at range, but they lack fighting power and defense up close.
BowGoblin.Flavortext: Goblins who have been exposed to larger amounts of dark mana during the Awakening gain a slight, but not insignificant, increase in their intelligence levels and are able to perform more complex tasks such as crafting bows and hunting food for their tribe.

ShamanGoblin.Name: Goblin Shaman
ShamanGoblin.Description: Uses mana magic to heal goblins and other beasts. The healing orb has a travel time, and they can't heal other shaman goblins.
ShamanGoblin.Flavortext: Shamans are the apex of their tribes, as they manage tribe affairs and serve as protectors of their tribe. They possess a wealth of experience in ancient spells and show much higher levels of intelligence and dark mana concentration compared to their peers. They dyed several parts of their bodies and wore animal tooth charms as a sign of power. Their rudimentary staff seems to serve as a catalyst for their magic.

Bat.Name: Bat
Bat.Description: Bats float over you, dropping blood projectiles from above to deal damage. They have little to no defense when attacked mid-air.
Bat.Flavortext: Lesser accumulations of dark mana managed to form organic living matter and manifested as winged creatures with lust for blood. They use their venom-laced fangs to incapacitate their prey and absorb their blood. You will find plenty of them inhibiting murky dungeons and caverns
